definition: Amber status implies caution in the management of the Conservation Unit. While a CU in the Amber zone should be at a low risk of loss, there will be a degree of lost production. Decisions about the conservation of CUs in the Amber zone will involve broader consideration of biological, social, and economic issues.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition: A group of fish sufficiently isolated from other groups that, if extirpated, is very unlikely to recolonize naturally within an acceptable timeframe.
definition_source: Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon Glossary.
definition_source_text: Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon Glossary.

definition: Social and economic considerations will tend to be the primary drivers for the management of Conservation Units in the Green zone, though ecosystem or other non-consumptive use values could also be considered.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition: Wild Salmon Policy metric comparing current generational average to long-term average spawner abundance.
Wild Salmon Policy metric quantifying linear change in spawner abundance over the most recent three generations.

A Conservation Unit in the Red zone is undesirable because of the risk of extirpation, and the loss of ecological benefits and salmon production. Changes in status will trigger management actions that will vary depending on species, geographic regions, and cause of the decline.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition: Wild Salmon Policy metric comparing generational average spawner abundance to CU-specific benchmarks (for example Sgen or 80% SMSY).
A biologically meaningful but operationally-focused salmon demographic unit used in assessment and reporting.
definition_source: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary; Pacific Salmon Commission Technical Report No. 49.
definition_source_text: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary; Pacific Salmon Commission Technical Report No. 49.

definition: A collection of stocks that are managed together with a joint stock status.
definition_source: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary.
definition_source_text: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary.

definition: The overall proportion of the total return of adult salmon removed by all fisheries over a defined period, aggregating across gear or fishery components.

A threshold below which fishing must be reduced to avoid reaching the LRP. The USR must be set at an appropriate distance above the LRP to provide sufficient opportunity for managers to recognize a declining stock status and sufficient time for management actions to take effect.
definition_source: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary.
definition_source_text: DFO Introduction to Stock Assessment Glossary.

term_name: Wild Salmon Policy biological status zone
definition: The biological status of a Conservation Unit (CU) will normally be based on the abundance and distribution of spawners in the unit, or proxies thereof. For each CU, higher and lower benchmarks will be defined that will delimit three status zones: Green, Amber, and Red. As spawner abundance decreases, a CU moves towards the lower status zone, and the extent of management intervention for conservation purposes will increase.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition: Controlled vocabulary for the Wild Salmon Policy rapid-status metrics and related analytical concepts.
Controlled vocabulary for biological status zones under the Wild Salmon Policy.
One of the standard Wild Salmon Policy rapid-status metrics (absolute abundance, relative abundance, long-term trend, or percent change).
definition_source: Pestal, G. et al. (2023). State of the Salmon: Rapid Status Assessment Approach for Pacific Salmon under Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy.
definition_source_text: Pestal, G. et al. (2023). State of the Salmon: Rapid Status Assessment Approach for Pacific Salmon under Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy.
